title: Domaine Matray 2016 Cuvée Les Paquelets  (Juliénas)
description: This is a ripe, densely structured wine with the typical perfumed character of the appellation. Ripe berry fruits and layers of acidity lift the wine and give it a crisp texture. Produced from 75-year-old vines, it will be ready to drink from late 2018.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Angel Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Rich in fruit and oak flavors, this medium to full-bodied wine has cinnamon and cedar aromas, ripe black cherry and red-cherry flavors, a firm and rather tannic texture and an oaky spicy finish. A sense of warmth and sweetness makes it hard to resist.

title: Florent Descombe 2016 Cuvée M Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: One of a range of wines produced by négociant Florent Descombe, this properly structured wine is rich in black fruits as well as tannins. Coming from the impressive Côte du Py slope, it has power and concentration as well as layers of fruit. Age this wine longer and drink from late 2018.

title: Foley 2015 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The inviting nose on this bottling combines rich black cherry, zesty raspberry, allspice and dried ginger aromas. The palate delivers big fruit flavors of baked boysenberries and ripe cranberries, which are balanced by a bit of tartness.

title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Clone 05 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is more full bodied and rich than first glance would suggest. It has a rather light red mahogany color. Generous strawberry and red-cherry flavors on a mouth-filling texture show light tannins and relatively soft acidity but plenty of viscosity. It was made from 100% Pommard clone vines and aged in 60% new French oak.

title: Furthermore 2014 Gloria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smooth on entry, with a gravelly texture that develops in the glass, this wine welcomes with a strong perfume of rose petal and strawberry. High-toned, it integrates healthy portions of oak into the savory fruit, with a persistence of acidity on the finish.

title: Gård 2014 Lawrence Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Blended with 14% Merlot, aromas of char, smoke, ground green herb, spice box, graphite and dark cherry lead to plentiful, saturated dark fruit and barrel flavors with a pleasing mouthfeel. It hits a lot of high notes.

title: Georges Duboeuf 2016 Jean-Ernest Descombes Côte du Py  (Morgon)
description: Named after the grower who owned the estate for many years (his daughter now runs it), this wine is dense, structured and complex. It has a strong mineral element as well as generous tannins and ripe berry fruits. This complex wine will age well. Drink from 2019.

title: Geyerhof 2016 Ried Steinleithn Grüner Veltliner (Kremstal)
description: This wine's wonderfully heady citrus pith and pear notes hit the nose. The palate joins with a rounded mouthfeel and more savory flavors; this is all about textured miso and salty sage. A spike of lemon brightness leads to a clean finish.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Devil's Inkstand Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This blends in 13% Petit Verdot and 6% Syrah, strong, powerful varieties that contribute power and dark color. Blackberry, chocolate and coconut ride a rich wavelength of soft mellowed tannin and fig flavor, finishing in a bite of graham cracker.

title: Jean Loron 2016 Domaine de la Vieille Eglise  (Juliénas)
description: This wine, with its floral aroma, is rounded, potentially rich and has layers of firm tannins. It comes from a blend of two of the sectors of Juliénas, a combination that brings out great fruit and a fine, dusty structure. Drink this wine with its good potential from late 2018.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chenoweth Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a great site, this tiny production wine is dark gold in color and oaky on the nose. Baked caramel apple, lemon chiffon and nutmeg all play a role—bold flavors that highlight this well-made effort that offers a throughput of bright acidity.

title: Lumen 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Fresh lime-spritzer aromas meet with whiffs of smoke and wood ash on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely zippy, with sea salt and lemon-zest flavors on the forefront and more complex Brie rind, cashew cream and dried apple toward the finish.

title: Manu 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Marlborough)
description: Aromatic and attractive, this wine spends a little time on its skins, causing it to burst with aromas of flowers, peaches, lime leaf and a bit of honey. The skins also contribute to the satiny texture, balanced by crisp acidity and finishing with a limey, saline tang.

title: Marchesi Antinori 2014 Marchese Antinori Riserva Tenuta Tignanello  (Chianti Classico)
description: Aromas of tilled soil, plum cake, exotic spice and a whiff of toasted oak come to the forefront of the nose. Elegantly structured, the taut, linear palate doles out wild cherry, cranberry, licorice, crushed herb and clove set against vibrant acidity and fine-grained tannins. Drink from 2019–2024.

title: Michael David 2014 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)
description: This lush, plush and almost syrupy wine has oodles of blackberry and chocolate aromas, a full body and ripe fruit flavors. A subtle layer of oak spice intermingles with all that fruit while soft tannins make it feel broad but not astringent on the palate.

title: Miller Wine Works 2014 Naked Vine Vineyard Grenache (El Dorado)
description: This is an extremely smooth, mellow, complex and interesting wine. From the first whiff of cedar and cinnamon in the aroma, to intricate flavors of raspberry, black tea and clove, it brings a lot of nuances to the palate and wraps them in a soft blanket of mild acidity and light tannins.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied, well-balanced and mouth-filling wine that offers ripe berry and cherry flavors enhanced by subtle baking spices. It has a good framework of fine-grained tannins and supportive acidity to keep it lively on the palate.

title: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: Parducci has been making great-value Petite Sirah for decades and here's another super example. This is an unusually complex wine for the varietal, offering hints of violet, anise and black pepper, along with rich blackberry aromas and flavors. The mouthfeel is big and tannic, but not overly so, and the rich flavors melt over the palate and linger a long time on the finish.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Cofermented with just under 5% Viognier, this varietal wine was aged in neutral French oak, the better to let its earthy core speak loudest. Mushroom, pine forest and black pepper highlight a broad brawny plate that's densely packed and moderately structured.

title: Red Newt Cellars 2014 The Knoll Lahoma Vineyards Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Sourced from a particularly well-drained block in the Lahoma Vineyards—located on the western shore of Seneca Lake—this is an incredibly pristine dry Riesling, with aromas of racy lime, ripe green pear and crushed stone. The palate offers an intriguing balance between weight and tension, showing ripe tree fruit braced by a vein of lime zest and powdered minerals, ending on an ultraclean, quinine finish.

title: Southern Right 2015 Pinotage (Hemel en Aarde)
description: Ripe boysenberry, blackberry and cherry tones are accented by hints of game, licorice root and lemon oil in this well-balanced and accessible Pinotage. The palate is smooth and plush, with well-integrated tannins and enough acidity to balance the opulent fruit flavors.

title: The Drift 2015 Gift Horse Barbera (Overberg)
description: A rich overlay of cocoa and roasted coffee bean sit atop ripe, brambly notes of blackberry, boysenberry and black cherry on the nose and mouth of this decadent, immediately likeable bottling. The plush mouthfeel offers silky tannins, with ample acidity and hits of toasted oak and fresh mint leaves that add depth and lift through the close.

title: Westwood 2015 Legend Estate Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a proprietary estate-grown blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Zinfandel, aged in French oak (45% new). Savory flavors of earth, black licorice, tobacco, meat and leather are lifted on the palate by fresh blueberry and blackberry tones, dusted in chocolate shavings.

title: Weszeli 2015 Ried Schenkenbichl Grüner Veltliner (Kamptal)
description: The smell of freshly peeled ripe golden pears shimmers on the nose of this wine, alongside yeasty richness. The palate puts more stress on the rich, textured seam of yeast, which has a satisfying, sonorous miso note.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Wanderlust Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Tangy plum skins and mulberry sauce meet with salt and pepper and roasted duck aromas on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre. The palate is full of brambly fruit, lifted by smoke and sagebrush.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lovely aromas of exotic red cherries, sultry mace, spicy cinnamon and white sage show on the nose of this fresh and crisp bottling. There is ample peppery spice to the palate and a strong tannic tension, with flavors of Earl Grey tea, cranberry and pomegranate. Cherry compote shows on the finish.

title: Esterházy 2016 Chardonnay (Leithaberg)
description: A creamy note of yellow apple fruit constitutes this wine's nose. The palate follows through with creamy, rounded but still precise freshness. This is a slender, textured Chardonnay with bright, lemon-like acidity and a leesy texture.

title: Carmel Road 2014 South Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Soft red rose petals, cranberry, wet slate and dust show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first new-block designates released by this producer. The palate's plush texture carries strong soil flavors of crushed gravel and turned earth, which give depth to the background of ripe raspberry and pomegranate fruit.

title: Boudreaux Cellars 2010 Reserve Champoux and Loess Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Washington)
description: This wine hails from two top vineyards. A full eight-years-old and coming from a cool vintage, the aromas are light, with notes of cedar, cherry and herb, dotted with wood spice. The palate brings quite tart fruit flavors, accented by racy acidity and supported by firm, tightly wound tannins. With acid like this, it absolutely requires some food alongside it to be properly enjoyed. Steak should do.
